newsitem.title: USA: San Diego, Calif., to refinance assessment bonds.
newsitem.headline: San Diego, Calif., to refinance assessment bonds.

text.p: California's San Diego County plans to refinance $21.8 million of assessment district bonds next week, the county's underwriter said on Wednesday.
The bond deal will refund San Diego's 4-S Ranch Project bonds, which were on the verge of a payment default one year ago, underwriter Stone & Youngberg LLC said in a statement.
The firm said bondholders would be paid 103 percent of par through the refunding. The deal will also provide property owners an annual tax savings of about 10 percent per year.

The refunding bond issue was approved by the county Board of Supervisors on July 15 and was expected to be sold during the week of July 28, according to Stone & Youngberg, the deal's senior managing underwriter.
